definition: A measure of rhythmic organization or beat in music, often used to indicate the tempo or pace of a musical piece. It is commonly employed in conducting, composing, and performing music.

examples.german: Der Takt der Musik war sehr schnell.
examples.english: The tempo of the music was very fast.

examples.german: Der Dirigent gab den Takt vor.
Sie hat einen guten Takt für Mode.
examples.english: She has a good sense of fashion.

examples.german: Im Takt der Trommeln tanzten sie durch die Straßen.
examples.english: They danced through the streets to the rhythm of the drums.
